segment.source: How to Manage the App-V Client Cache Using Performance Counters
segment.target: How to Manage the App-V Client Cache Using Performance Counters

segment.source: How to Manage the App-V Client Cache Using Performance Counters
segment.target: How to Manage the App-V Client Cache Using Performance Counters

segment.source: How to Manage the App-V Client Cache Using Performance Counters
segment.target: How to Manage the App-V Client Cache Using Performance Counters

segment.source: You can use the following procedure to determine how much free space is available in the Application Virtualization (App-V) client cache by using Performance Monitor to display the information graphically.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to determine how much free space is available in the Application Virtualization (App-V) client cache by using Performance Monitor to display the information graphically.

segment.source: This information is captured on the client computer by a performance counter called “App Virt Client Cache,” and it includes the following counters: “Cache size (MB),” “Cache free space (MB),” and “% free space.”
segment.target: This information is captured on the client computer by a performance counter called “App Virt Client Cache,” and it includes the following counters: “Cache size (MB),” “Cache free space (MB),” and “% free space.”

segment.source: To determine client cache space usage
segment.target: To determine client cache space usage

segment.source: Open a command prompt as administrator, or click Start, Run, type perfmon.exe, and click OK.
segment.target: Open a command prompt as administrator, or click Start, Run, type perfmon.exe, and click OK.

segment.source: Depending on the Windows operating system being used, click the Performance Monitor or System Monitor tool after the MMC window opens.
segment.target: Depending on the Windows operating system being used, click the Performance Monitor or System Monitor tool after the MMC window opens.

segment.source: To add counters, right-click the graph area and select Add Counters.
segment.target: To add counters, right-click the graph area and select Add Counters.

segment.source: Click the drop-down to display the list of available counters, scroll to find App Virt Client Cache, and then add the three counters.
segment.target: Click the drop-down to display the list of available counters, scroll to find App Virt Client Cache, and then add the three counters.

segment.source: The App-V performance counters are implemented in a 32-bit DLL, so to see them, you must use the following command to start the 32-bit version of Performance Monitor: mmc /32 perfmon.msc.
segment.target: The App-V performance counters are implemented in a 32-bit DLL, so to see them, you must use the following command to start the 32-bit version of Performance Monitor: mmc /32 perfmon.msc.

segment.source: This command must be run directly on the computer being monitored and cannot be used to monitor a remote computer running a 64-bit operating system.
segment.target: This command must be run directly on the computer being monitored and cannot be used to monitor a remote computer running a 64-bit operating system.

segment.source: How to Manage Virtual Applications by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Manage Virtual Applications by Using the Command Line
